description.narrative:
The overall objective of project is enhanced capacity and space for civil society organizations in Lebanon to influence their government and international actors to adopt policies that more effectively meet the needs of vulnerable displaced persons and host communities, and implement them effectively.
The specific objectives are: 1) Increased capacity of civil society operating in Lebanon to monitor and analyse the impacts of, and influence regulatory frameworks and policies on the protection of forcibly displaced persons. 2) Increased space for civil society to influence and hold accountable national governments and international actors on forced displacement and protection frameworks, and on financing mechanisms in response to forced displacement.
The project will create an informal network of human rights and protection partners; provide them with a venue to discuss findings and evidence from their fieldwork and combining it with trends analysis at the national and international levels, identification of key issues, examining protection responses, and identifying legal protection alternatives. Activities also include training and technical assistance on strategyand campaign development; support to coalition partners to develop an agreed approach and strategy for analysis of protection trends, and funding for initiatives to respond to protection issues and pilot new approaches. There will be lobby meetings in Lebanon with various stakeholders and facilitation and follow up of coalition meetings. The role of Oxfam Novib will be to link activities in Lebanon to the international level in order to influence global level policy developments and advocate for implementation of commitments coming out of the fall summits. Lebanon level work will feed into Oxfam#s global displacement campaign.
Other activities consist of a first learning event with civil society organizations and activists from Lebanon and other refugee-hosting countries in the region on changes in protection frameworks and forced displacement in different contexts; a strategy workshop for the broader coalition of organizations participating in the learning event, lobby initiatives in Lebanon including roundtable events on development financing in the context of protracted displacement and protection frameworks; a lobby tour for partners to visit key targets at the international level especially in Europe; as well as a policy brief to support evidence-based advocacy. The project will also finance a second multi-stakeholder learning event that brings together practitioners from Lebanon and other countries hosting large displaced populations, experts, entrepreneurs, and donors to conceptualise new responses to forced displacement. Other activities are mapping of innovative responses to forced displacement and (comparative) research between Lebanon and other contexts. Oxfam Novib will amplify the efforts of national civil society through its networks, facilitate their international access through travel support and accompaniment, and advocate for space for national civil society in international policy processes.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to life and security
